intro: Endlicheria griseosericea, commonly known as the gray-haired endlicheria, is a species of flowering plant native to the Andes mountains in South America. It is a perennial shrub characterized by its silver-gray foliage and delicate, white or pale pink flowers. The plant has hairy stems and leaves, which give it its common name. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in high-altitude regions. Endlicheria griseosericea is valued for its ornamental appeal and is cultivated in botanical gardens for its unique appearance.
